intro: Discophora guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan discophore, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Discophora guianensis is often found growing near streams or in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat.
